title: Hong Kong’s star-crossed bid for the LSE was doomed from the start
text:
Charles Li should probably stay away from Shakespeare for a while.

The boss of the Hong Kong stock exchange had excitedly compared his courtship of London to Romeo and Juliet but the brief romance has suffered the same tragic fate as the Bard’s star-crossed lovers.

Just four weeks after popping up with a £32bn offer, HKEX has been forced to admit defeat. After the LSE’s emphatic rejection, it was counting on support from the City to pursue a hostile bid but received short shrift again.

This tale of woe will be remembered as one of the more bizarre episodes that the Square Mile has seen in a long time. Poorly timed, badly executed, and facing insurmountable obstacles, the approach seemed doomed...
